data.title: I'm sad that Shadow Hearts series is dead and has no spiritual successor.

data.text:
There are a lot of great JRPG series out there in the past that deserve a lot of love, and I think Shadow Hearts franchise is one of them. This series lived and died with the Playstation 2, and to this day, to my knowledge, has not seen a single game inspired by this amazing RPG series which is a damn shame.

Shadow Hearts and its sequel(s) are quite unique as far as JRPG goes. While majority of JRPG's are set in entirely fantasy/sci-fi world, Shadow Hearts games take place in alternate history of our real world, mostly set in not so distant past around World War 1. That said, you would be exploring places across the globe during those time period, and all the while experiencing a unique, darker twist to the world, and the story that was told. The games decidedly took elements of survival horror genre with regards to the atmosphere and story-telling, which was fascinating and rarely done in the genre. The gameplay in these games are also quite fun, featuring a system that test player's timing and reflex with the judgement ring. The story was brilliant IMO especially how the game connects the first game and the sequel, actually has good sense of humor so it's not completely dark and tense. The characters are interesting and likeable (Yuri is one of the best JRPG protag), and the music in the first two games was done by Yasunori Mitsuda of Chrono and Xenogears fame, they were amazing.

Alas, all good things come to an end, but I'm hoping for a miracle that we might see a new game or a spiritual successor of some sort to this franchise.

The third game was a major snoozefest though, couldn't get into that at all. But yeah the first 2 games are fairly unique games. 2 lost some of the atmosphere, but overall I thought it was the best in the series.

From the New World definitely is a step back in terms of everything aside from the gameplay. It was the strongest there in that aspect, but unfortunately they ditched a lot of the elements that made the first two so good. IMO still a pretty solid game for what it is.

This is really makes me sad, I love the first 2 games (FtNW doesn't exist). Machida talking about making a new game did make me pretty happy but it's probably going to be a spiritual successor and not a actual sequel.

"I guess that there are people interested in an RPG with features from Shadow Hearts, but I also feel that they are a minority compared to fans of other RPGs in general. On a personal level, obviously the presence of such fans is indeed precious. Should I get the chance to, one day I would like to create something able to answer their expectations, and I would definitely throw all of myself into it."
